meanings.definition: The quality or state of being capable of being thought about or considered.
meanings.sent1: The thinkableness of the problem made it easy to analyze.
meanings.sent2: Her essay lacked the necessary thinkableness to engage the readers.
meanings.sent3: The thinkableness of the situation was so clear that everyone could understand it.
meanings.sent4: The thinkableness of the mystery was like a puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent5: The thinkableness of the concept was so intriguing that it stayed in my mind for days.

meanings.definition: The ability to be pondered or reflected upon.
meanings.sent1: The thinkableness of the poem left the audience in deep thought.
meanings.sent2: His speech lacked the necessary thinkableness to captivate the listeners.
meanings.sent3: The thinkableness of the theory was so profound that it sparked a lively debate.
meanings.sent4: The thinkableness of the painting was like a mirror reflecting different emotions.
meanings.sent5: The thinkableness of the question made everyone pause and reflect before answering.
